page.title: 06Housing at Perry.
page.content: During the 1970's a development of over 200 single and double storey homes were built south of Grafham Water, either side of the Great Staughton and Grafham Parish Boundary. Great Staughton named roads after local residents such as Cowley and Hawkins and after the farmhouse lost under the water, Glebe Roundhouse. Grafham named roads after 20th Century sailors such as Blythe and Rose. As a result of pressure by the new residents to become autonomous, the Parish of Perry was formed in 1981. Independence was only possible because of the revenue from the Water Authority for the part of the parish under water: a loss that Grafham and Great Staughton fought. There are 265 houses in Perry with no future building planned save infill housing.
